answers.answer: Do you check your blood pressure? It can be the beginnings of preeclampsia. That's what I'm going through right now. It can cause dizziness, headaches, swelling and it's very serious. It could also be you're just standing up too fast. I would talk to the doctor
I dont have swelling or headaches though....what causes preeclampsia?
It can also happen if your sinuses are clogged or if your ears are plugged or low blood sugar.But do check your blood pressure like the previous post said to rule out a serious complication.

Preeclampsia is a serious problem, its dangerously high blood pressure caused by the pregnancy. They only cure is to deliver the baby, as it can lead to a situation when the mother's life is at risk. But it can be managed.Low blood pressure can also cause dizziness.I get randomly dizzy a lot, like you describe with the room spinning even with my eyes closed. I was told it is benign vertigo, it mean that sometimes my inner swells. Normally i take a decongestant and a anti-inflamatory, but that only helps if it is the ear thing, and it not the safest combo while pregnant. It always goes away on its own, though it can last a few hours.

I had an ob appt on the 21 and they didnt say anything about me having preeclampsia..... i havent checked my blood pressure since.... but can it be my sugar is too high??.... i have a little machine that checks sugar.... and just curious...does preeclampsia go away after you have the baby?
So i took my sugar test and it came out to be 85..... is that too low?

Are you diabetic? That really changes how your body reacts to low and high sugar. I don't know the normal range of blood sugar. I just know when i don't eat much i get dizzy.Preeclampsia is caused by being pregnant, so it goes away once the baby is born. It is more common with first or second pregnancies.The list of things that can make you dizzy is really long and go from extremely minor to serious.You just be dehydrated too.

85 is good... Usually you want it between 80-120 so your sugars are great... I had preeclampsia with my first and only had swelling as a symptom so its definitely worth callIng your on just to get a professional opinion.
Thanks ladies....this is my 3rd pregnancy and i have to admit im not a water drinker...so maybe i am dehydrated..... no im not diabetic....

question: So i started feeling very dizzy this morning when i woke up... like if im staring at somethig i get dizzy or i also tried laying back down and resting my eyes but i feel like if the room is spinning...its horrible...what can it be?? Im 34 weeks btw!! Thanks girls!!
title: what can  it be???
